ygData.subject: How to get a smooth output distribution?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, no matter what experiment I try, I have always the same problem: Let s say there are three output neurons, in my training data there is only one output

Subject: How to get a smooth output distribution?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=8147458; y=YLciOnPHe3hanTN4qtDvUiQPWBx9qGEwYmRTYSRbQ-uK04gr_Q
X-Yahoo-Profile: chhofchhof

Hello,

no matter what experiment I try, I have always the same problem:

L=
et's say there are three output neurons, in my training data there is only =
one output neuron valid. So there is no example where one output neuron is =
active with an other output neuron. But I still want to get a percentage di=
stribution. 

Now I expected to get a output distribution like:

33%, 33%, =
33%

But most of the time I get:

100%, 0%, 0%
0%, 100%, 0%
0%, 0%, 100%

I=
 think it is a matter of the fitness function.

I use the following method:=


The fitness for one training data is the sum of the correct decisions.
So=
 when neuron A is correct and neat says A 100%, it gets 1.0 fitness for thi=
s test data. If it says it is B, then it gets 0 fitness. I sum this up and =
divide it by the example count. So when it says it is 50% A, then it would =
get 0.5 fitness and so on.

But the network still only favorites one decisi=
on.
I tried to favorites correct decisions log(hit ratio), but this does no=
t change anything.

When the input data is exactly the same and I have 6 ti=
mes A, 3 times B and 1 time C as correct output, then I want 60%, 30%, 10% =
and not always 100% for A.

What can I change to achieve such a percentage =
distribution?
I think it has nothing to do with other neat parameters but t=
he fitness function. With my fitness function the fitness would be the same=
 if it says always 100%, 0%, 0% or if it says 60%, 30%, 10%.

What shall I =
do?

Thanks,

Chris
